What You Just Experienced

As you configured the garden, you experienced something that traditional documentation cannot offer: a single guide that seamlessly adapted to your choices, yet was built from reusable, always-accurate components.

Behind that simple interaction were principles that change documentation forever:

  • It Was Built to Last. The guide wasn’t a fragile, static document. It was a living system, assembled from blocks of knowledge. Changing a single block - a plant’s spacing requirement, a module’s specification - updates every guide that uses it, instantly and without error.
  • It Was Effortless to Follow. The path felt natural, like a conversation. But unlike a chat with an AI, every piece of advice was grounded in verifiable, authoritative knowledge, with no risk of hallucination.
  • It Scales Without Breaking. What you saw was a garden, but the same system can effortlessly manage the endless variables of a crisis, a complex product, or an entire organisation’s procedures. The complexity is handled behind the scenes, while the user receives only the clarity they need.
  • It is text. In your own git repository.

This is the shift: from writing documents that are hard to keep accurate, to building a knowledge system that is inherently consistent, clear, and maintainable.
